channel.title: Joe Buhlig
channel.description: leverage the digital and welcome real life

item.title: 22: Aliens On The Podcast
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe sabotaged Josh’s weight loss goal. He had to do something since he had dumpster fires and didn’t want to be alone in the fire.
item.content:encoded: Joe sabotaged Josh’s weight loss goal. He had to do something since he had dumpster fires and didn’t want to be alone in the fire.

item.title: 21: We're Going With Gooder
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe has lost all the good words. Josh is making a derivative of bacon. And goals were mentioned in here somewhere. Which means this is likely the backwards show.
item.content:encoded: Joe has lost all the good words. Josh is making a derivative of bacon. And goals were mentioned in here somewhere. Which means this is likely the backwards show.

item.title: 20: Time For A Do-Over
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh had a rough first recording. So they re-recorded this week’s episode in person. So the audio is a bit raw. Ignore it. Focus on the dumpster fires instead.
item.content:encoded: Josh had a rough first recording. So they re-recorded this week’s episode in person. So the audio is a bit raw. Ignore it. Focus on the dumpster fires instead.

item.title: 7: Whole Wheat
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Ulysses and the subscription model for apps. Medium versus Jekyll. Also, Joe bakes some sourdough bread.
item.content:encoded: Ulysses and the subscription model for apps. Medium versus Jekyll. Also, Joe bakes some sourdough bread.

item.title: 19: I Forgot to Pack Underwear
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: A goal has been met! Now to make it bigger. But another has led Joe down a completely different path. Did we mention Josh became a starfish for a while?
item.content:encoded: A goal has been met! Now to make it bigger. But another has led Joe down a completely different path. Did we mention Josh became a starfish for a while?

item.title: 33: The Legend of the Monk and the Merchant by Terry Felber
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: This show comes with a disclaimer as Mike and Joe talk about faith, the church, and business. There are fine lines and lots of opinions on all of these.
item.content:encoded: This show comes with a disclaimer as Mike and Joe talk about faith, the church, and business. There are fine lines and lots of opinions on all of these.

item.title: 18: The Guild Turns Pro
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh encourages Joe to sell the Guild and not be dumb as the Pro section opens. And they both dive into an interesting conversation on being genuine online.
item.content:encoded: Josh encourages Joe to sell the Guild and not be dumb as the Pro section opens. And they both dive into an interesting conversation on being genuine online.

item.title: 6: I Could Just Do It for 10,000
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe and Drew talk about working from home, freelancing, and keeping your own schedule. Also of note: A new package from Joe’s secret admirer.
item.content:encoded: Joe and Drew talk about working from home, freelancing, and keeping your own schedule. Also of note: A new package from Joe’s secret admirer.

item.title: 17: The Explicit Show
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh has been waiting and waiting for this show to get here. And now it’s here. You’ve been warned. Also, Joe has some big news about the Guild.
item.content:encoded: Josh has been waiting and waiting for this show to get here. And now it’s here. You’ve been warned. Also, Joe has some big news about the Guild.

item.title: 32: The Art of Thinking Clearly by Rolf Dobelli
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: This week Mike and Joe talk about the cognitive biases that they struggle with and the ones they are fascinated by. And it seems there are a lot of these. So picking a few is not as easy as it sounds.
item.content:encoded: This week Mike and Joe talk about the cognitive biases that they struggle with and the ones they are fascinated by. And it seems there are a lot of these. So picking a few is not as easy as it sounds.

item.title: 16: I'm a Blue Person
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Fires all around. Joe adds to the list of people he blames for missed goals. Josh is not losing weight. And they both struggle with being real on the internet.
item.content:encoded: Fires all around. Joe adds to the list of people he blames for missed goals. Josh is not losing weight. And they both struggle with being real on the internet.

item.title: 5: A Beautiful Utopia of Input
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe goes to MacStock and sparks a discussion on the subject of conferences. Drew takes a deep dive into the strength of ‘Input’ and the helpful benefits of personality assessments. Also…Joe considers blacksmithing?
item.content:encoded: Joe goes to MacStock and sparks a discussion on the subject of conferences. Drew takes a deep dive into the strength of ‘Input’ and the helpful benefits of personality assessments. Also…Joe considers blacksmithing?

item.title: 15: Make The Bad Guy Relatable
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh doesn’t like sleeping and learned some things about writing without mental reserves. Joe rebranded the Guild and started pulling in content. And both of them digress on finances and chip cards.
item.content:encoded: Josh doesn’t like sleeping and learned some things about writing without mental reserves. Joe rebranded the Guild and started pulling in content. And both of them digress on finances and chip cards.

item.title: 31: The Power of a Positive No by William Ury
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Saying No. It’s something neither Mike nor Joe enjoy doing but know they need to embrace. The question is whether or not they can bring themselves to do it.
item.content:encoded: Saying No. It’s something neither Mike nor Joe enjoy doing but know they need to embrace. The question is whether or not they can bring themselves to do it.

item.title: 14: What Comes First?
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Are Josh and Joe trading places? And how does one go about marketing themselves without coming across as pushy? Also, they want to share more tidbits. So there’s more tidbits.
item.content:encoded: Are Josh and Joe trading places? And how does one go about marketing themselves without coming across as pushy? Also, they want to share more tidbits. So there’s more tidbits.
